tei:
<pb n="70"/>
<head>C:2003</head><lb/>
“The Iniquity of Oblivion Foil’d,” in The Pleasures of Bibliophily: Fifty Years of “The <hi rend="italic">Book Collector</hi>,” edited by A. S. G. Edwards (London: British Library; New Castle, Del.: Oak Knoll Press, 2003), pp. 100-06. Reprinted from <hi rend="italic">The Book Collector</hi> (D:1966, Autumn). Cf. A:1933 and D:1933 (February) for an earlier essay with the same title.<lb/>
<head>C:2004</head><lb/>
[Extensive extracts from Carter’s letters], in Donald C. Dickinson’s <hi rend="italic">John Carter: The Taste and Technique of a Bookman</hi> (New Castle, Del.: Oak Knoll Press, 2004).<lb/>
<head>D. Contributions to Periodicals<lb/>(except the <hi rend="italic">Times Literary Supplement</hi>)</head><lb/>
<head>D:1926</head><lb/>
R [Review of Martin F. Nilsson’s <hi rend="italic">Imperial Rome</hi>], <hi rend="italic">Cambridge Review</hi>, 30 April 1926, pp. 368-69. Signed “J.W.C.”<lb/>
<head>D:1927</head><lb/>
R “More of Agate’s Folly,” <hi rend="italic">Cambridge Review</hi>, 18 February 1927, p. 269. Signed “J.W.C.” Review of James Agate’s <hi rend="italic">The Common Touch</hi>.<lb/>
<head>D:1928</head><lb/>
L “More Vandalism,” <hi rend="italic">Saturday Review</hi>, 1 December 1928, p. 722. Signed “J. W. Carter and V. C. Clinton-Baddeley.” On the demolition of statuary at Tottenham Court Road and New Oxford Street.<lb/>
<head>D:1930</head><lb/>
L [Letter on defining “first edition”], <hi rend="italic">Bookmart</hi>, October 1930, p. 13. Carter’s name is signed as from “The First Edition Club, London, W.C.1.”<lb/>
A “Original Condition: An Appeal to Reason,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 118 (1930 [15 November]): 2277-79. In the Eton copy, Carter noted, “the first article I ever wrote for the Publisher’s Weekly.”<lb/>
<head>D:1931</head><lb/>
A “Looking Backward,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 119 (1931 [17 January]): 330-32.<lb/>
L “The Earliest Cloth Binding,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Circular</hi> 135 (1931): 781. On A. Whitaker Ridler’s article, pp. 763-64.<lb/>
A “Looking Forward,” <hi rend="italic">Publishers’ Weekly</hi> 119 (1931 [20 June]): 2889-91.<lb/>
A “Personality in Notepaper,” <hi rend="italic">The Queen</hi>, 12 August 1931, pp. 37, 46. On typography.<lb/>
R “A Bibliography of Sir William Schwenck Gilbert,” <hi rend="italic">The Book Collector’s Quarterly</hi> 4 [1.4] (October-December 1931): 61-64. Review of Townley Searle’s bibliography of Gilbert.<lb/>
L “Sir Thomas Browne,” <hi rend="italic">The London Mercury</hi> 24 (1931 [October]): 361.<lb/>
